Very good course, much work but felt stills improving all semester. Would highly recommend to anyone interested in future work in statistics.

Strength: Wonderful lectures.
Weakness: Hard homework without solutions, which makes it very hard to understand which parts go wrong.
Very good. You can definitely learn a lot.
could be improved by going through how to code the examples we go over in class

pros:introduced a lot of tools in computational statistics.
cons: not very theoretical.

The lectures are well organized, informative and easy to understand. The lectures and the homework keep a good balance between theories and application (like programming), and maintain an appropriate workload. I actually don't have a very clear suggestion for improvements for now.
Very useful course!
Awesome!
This course is super good in terms of computational stat, it covers all the important algorithms, which is extremely helpful for the research.
This course helps me learn a lot about computational skills. I think it is perfect!
strengths: interesting/revelant materiel, weakness: sometimes tested on topics not covered in class.

This is an excellent course.  The instructor is an engaging speaker and is able to explain concepts that could be confusing in a very straightforward and clear way, such that they seem quite intuitive. The problem sets and exams are challenging but reasonable, and everything that one might need to know to solve them is included in the course.  The instructor and teaching fellow made themselves very available outside of class time so that we had every opportunity to ask the questions that we needed to.  I would highly recommend this course to another student.

Well organized 
Sometimes hw is not related to learning materials
Instructor was very helpful and clear in lectures and available for office hours.

Strength: Good lecturing.
Weakness: No typed notes and homework solutions, which makes this course inefficient.
Great instructor. Very patient and intelligent. Also funny.
Dr. Crawford explains everything clearly. He is patient and responsible.
Prof. Crawford is excellent. His class is very helpful.
Dr. Crawford gives the lectures in an interesting way. He is very accessible and responsive to our questions. And also, his hand-drawn 3D plots are impressing.
Very nice instructor! Very inspired for different approaches.
Awesome!
He is so good at explaining the ideas of different computational methods and so nice.
I really like Dr. Forrest's style! He's an intelligent and kind instructor. I appreciate his help!
great professor, helpful office hours, good at explaining theoretical topics.

The instructor's teaching style was great - his explanations of both concepts in the course and the expectations in the course were always very clear.  The course is well-designed in the sense that the problem sets ensured that we grasped the important ideas taught in the class and were able to use them.

Great instructor
Organized and knowledgeable
His explanation is very clear and easy understood
A lot of work and challenging, but will learn a lot. Would recommend to a serious student.
Great course if you want to enhance your computational skills. Very useful techniques and the homework problem settings are very realistic.
You can learn a lot by finishing assignments. Great course overall.
Great course! Yes.
An interesting and easy-to-understanding introduction to statistical computing theories and techniques. I would recommend it to students who are interested in, or who need, skills in related fields.
Great class! Useful Techniques
I think every computational guy should take this course, in the future, you will definitely use something from this course.
I would recommend this course to another student. It's helpful and interesting!
best class I've taken
See question 6.
Great course, learnt a lot of important topics
